reviewText: Unlike most of the Humongous titles, this game doesn't have a story mode. I am a fully grown man and this entertained me for about 10 minutes.

reviewText: Running a farm is no easy task, and this game explains how to a young audiance. Farming methods may have changed since this game was made, but gives people a general idea.\n\nHas a few mini-games for children and people to test themselves.

Good commentary on how the peasents lived back then.
We can truly understand the plight they went through since they couldn't understand how to read.
Minigames tell us that it is okay to lose sometimes even when we really wanted to win.

reviewText:
An Instant Childhood Arcade Classic, in which you get to learn about the Farm with Buzzy the Knowledge Bug in this Second Installment to Junior Field Trips Series. As you know The Farm is where food is grown and where Farm Animals live.

There's alot to see and do on The Farm, there's the Apple Orchard, Pond, Gardens, Pasture Fields and much more. There's Pigs, Chickens, Fish, Birds, Bugs and more animals to see & Learn about. With over 32 Places to Explore, a Built-In Airport Encyclopedia total of 220 Items, a 15 Page Coloring Book & 5 Different Minigames to play.

It's a Barnyard full of Fun and Learning in Let's Explore The Farm.
